intro: Spirostylis interruptus, commonly known as the interrupted spirea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to gardens. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its unique foliage and delicate flowers make it a popular choice for native landscaping.
